content:
I saw that this PR added a comment with the following wording:
"creating a *mut (dyn Trait + 'static) requires both an address and a vtable"

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/92150

And k wondered if that's a detail that the compiler should tell the user?

It's not a detail that the language currently specifies AFAIK and this warning might make users just change the code to also pass a vtable and transmute it.

(I might be over-thinking a simple warning though)
The word “vtable” has been showing up in error messages for a while. I had to add it specifically in my training slides.
Agreed that this seems pretty jargony. Could be worth bringing up in #t-compiler/wg-diagnostics
